com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.broadcast

Class WZGLBroadcaster

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.support.encoder.H264Encoder
      • com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.broadcast.WZH264Broadcaster
        • com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.broadcast.WZGLBroadcaster
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WZBroadcastAPI.AdaptiveBroadcaster, WZBroadcastAPI.Broadcaster, WZBroadcastAPI.VideoBroadcaster, Runnable

    public class WZGLBroadcaster
extends WZH264Broadcaster
    This class can be used to integrate the GoCoder SDK into an existing application's OpenGL ES-based rendering pipeline to broadcast content from sources other than WZCameraView

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WZGLBroadcaster()
      Construct a new instance
      WZGLBroadcaster(EGLContext eglContext)
      Construct a new instance specifying a shared EGLContext to use when creating OpenGL ES resources on the video encoder's thread
      WZGLBroadcaster(EGLContext eglContext, EGLSurface eglSurface) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Utility function to wrap a Surface instance with an EGLSurface.
      EGLContext getEglContext() 
      EGLSurface getEglSurface() 
      WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer getVideoFrameRenderer() 
      void onFrameAvailable()
      Call to notify the broadcaster that a new frame is available for capture.

      Call to notify the broadcaster that a new frame is available for capture with the specified timestamp.
      void setEglContext(EGLContext eglContext) 
      void setEglSurface(EGLSurface eglSurface)
      Set a EGLSurface instance to use for direct copy operations that has been created on the EGLContext supplied in the constructor for this instance or in a call to setEglContext(EGLContext)
      void setFrameRotation(int frameRotation)
      Call to notify the broadcaster of a change in the video source's orientation during a broadcast.
      void setFrameSize(int frameWidth, int frameHeight)
      Call to notify the broadcaster of a change in the video source's frame size during a broadcast such as when a device's orientation changes (e.g from portrait to landscape)
      void setVideoFrameRenderer(WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer videoFrameRenderer)
      Specify an instance implementing the WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer interface to call when a frame is available that will render the frame content to this broadcaster's encoder's input surface.

      • getVideoFrameRenderer

      • setVideoFrameRenderer

        public void setVideoFrameRenderer(WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer videoFrameRenderer)
        Specify an instance implementing the WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer interface to call when a frame is available that will render the frame content to this broadcaster's encoder's input surface.
        Parameters:
        videoFrameRenderer - an instance implementing the WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer interface

        Parameters:

      • getEglSurface

        public EGLSurface getEglSurface()
        Returns:
        the EGLSurface specified in the last call to setEglSurface(EGLSurface)

      • setEglSurface

        public void setEglSurface(EGLSurface eglSurface)
        Set a EGLSurface instance to use for direct copy operations that has been created on the EGLContext supplied in the constructor for this instance or in a call to setEglContext(EGLContext)
        Parameters:
        eglSurface - a source EGLSurface instance

      • generateEglSuface

        public EGLSurface generateEglSuface(Surface sourceSurface)
        Utility function to wrap a Surface instance with an EGLSurface. Note that an EGLContext must have been supplied in the constructor for this instance or in a call to setEglContext(EGLContext)
        Parameters:
        sourceSurface - the Surface instance to wrap
        Returns:
        a newly created EGLSurface attached to the EGLContext specified to the broadcaster

      • onFrameAvailable

        public void onFrameAvailable(long frameTimestampNs)
        Call to notify the broadcaster that a new frame is available for capture with the specified timestamp. This result in a subsequent call to the WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer instance supplied in the last call to setVideoFrameRenderer(WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer) to render the frame's content onto the video encoder's input surface
        Parameters:
        frameTimestampNs - the timestamp to use when encoding this frame, in nanoseconds

      • onFrameAvailable

        public void onFrameAvailable()
        Call to notify the broadcaster that a new frame is available for capture. This result in a subsequent call to the WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer instance supplied in the last call to setVideoFrameRenderer(WZRenderAPI.VideoFrameRenderer) to render the frame's content onto the video encoder's input surface

      • setFrameSize

        public void setFrameSize(int frameWidth,
                         int frameHeight)
        Call to notify the broadcaster of a change in the video source's frame size during a broadcast such as when a device's orientation changes (e.g from portrait to landscape)
        Parameters:
        frameWidth - the new video frame width
        frameHeight - the new video frame height

      • setFrameRotation

        public void setFrameRotation(int frameRotation)
        Call to notify the broadcaster of a change in the video source's orientation during a broadcast. The updated rotation value will be reflected in the frameRotation argument sent to the frame renderer
        Parameters:
        frameRotation - the new video source rotation (0-360)
